greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First occurrence of n in A068307: least number k such that the number of decomposition of k into the sum of three primes is n.
link: Robert G. Wilson v and T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{c = 0, lmt = PrimePi@ Floor[n/2], p, q}, Do[p = Prime@ i; q = Prime@ j; r = n - p - q; If[ PrimeQ@ r && r >= p, c++ ], {i, lmt}, {j, i}]; c]; t = Table[0, {1000}]; Do[a = f@n; If[t[[a]] == 0, t[[a]] = n; Print[{a, n}]], {n, 10^6}]
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 13 2008
